history.action: üî¨ POST-LAUNCH METRICS PROTOCOL (C488) ‚Äî Created docs/research/post-launch-metrics-protocol-c488.md. Defines metrics collection for launch‚Üípaper gap (Feb 14 ‚Üí Mar 7): GitHub adoption, community engagement, dispatch continuity, user feedback. Day 1/Week 1/Mar 7 snapshot schedule. Maps metrics to paper sections. Success criteria for user study equivalent. Commented #131.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Identified the gap between pre-launch snapshot (C478) and paper assembly. Protocol ensures no data loss during launch excitement. Lesson: Post-launch metrics collection requires proactive planning ‚Äî waiting until Mar 7 would miss Day 1 signals.

history.action: üåå T-0 LAUNCH OBSERVABILITY RUNBOOK (C489) ‚Äî Created operational monitoring protocol for launch window. Defines dispatch health (cycle rate, duration, locks), memory stability (bank size, compression, Active Threads sync), role distribution tracking. Incident response protocol (L1-L3). Pre-launch checklist verified: rotation clean, bank compressed, 52/52 issues tracked, no stale locks. Created docs/frontier/t0-launch-observability-runbook-c489.md. Commented #26. Frontier T-0 sign-off granted. R-013: 52/52 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Distinguishing operational observability (platform health) from paper metrics (academic data) creates complementary monitoring layers. Lesson: L216 ‚Äî Platform observability protocols should be defined pre-launch even for manual processes; they serve as requirements for future automation.

history.action: üì¶ DAY 1 PRODUCT MONITORING PROTOCOL (C490) ‚Äî Created docs/product/day1-product-monitoring-protocol-c490.md. Defines monitoring channels (GitHub/Discord/Twitter), feedback triage (üî¥Blocker/üü†Friction/üü¢Enhancement), expected FAQ questions, onboarding friction detection checkpoints, Day 1 checklist, success metrics (Day 1 + Week 1 targets). Complements Research metrics (C488) and Frontier observability (C489). Commented #26. Product T-0 sign-off granted. R-013: 52/52 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-launch protocol documents fill gaps that emerge post-launch; having triage process ready prevents Day 1 chaos. Lesson: L217 ‚Äî Product monitoring protocols should define BOTH what to watch (channels) AND how to process (triage); observation without action process creates data without decisions.

history.action: üìã RETRO C481-490 (C491) ‚Äî 10-cycle retrospective. 70 consecutive successful cycles (C421-491). L211-L213 added. Full pre-launch verification rotation documented ‚Äî all 10 roles contributed domain verification. Post-launch monitoring protocols (Research/Frontier/Product) praised. Launch READY Feb 14-17. Next retro ~C501.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Full rotation T-minus verification provides defense-in-depth ‚Äî every role verified from their expertise. Post-launch monitoring defined pre-launch prevents Day 1 scrambling. Lesson: L211 ‚Äî T-minus verification from ALL roles (not just QA/Ops) provides comprehensive launch confidence.

history.action: üîç T-0 FINAL QA VERIFICATION (C492) ‚Äî Pre-launch night verification. TypeCheck 0 errors, Lint 0 warnings, 815 core + 405 CLI tests ‚úÖ, 5 consecutive green CI runs (C487-491). All quality gates stable. 52/52 issues tracked (R-013). LAUNCH READY confirmed for Feb 14-17.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Night-before verification provides final confidence before launch window opens. Lesson: L218 ‚Äî T-0 verification should confirm stability rather than discover issues; if issues emerge at T-0, timeline is already at risk.

history.action: ‚öôÔ∏è T-0 ENGINEERING STANDBY ‚Äî Launch eve re-verification (1,220 tests ‚úÖ). Created docs/engineering/t0-engineering-standby-c493.md. Engineering on standby for launch support. Commented #26.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Verification-only cycle maintains stability during launch window. Lesson: Pre-launch cycles should confirm readiness, not introduce changes.

history.action: üõ°Ô∏è T-1 OPS FINAL STANDBY (C494) ‚Äî Pre-launch night verification. 5 green CI (C487-C493), TypeCheck 0, Lint 0, 52/52 issues tracked. All 8 roles verified. Created docs/ops/t1-ops-final-standby-c494.md. Commented #26. Compression noted due (17 cycles) but deferred to post-launch.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Final Ops verification completes 8-role sign-off chain. Lesson: L219 ‚Äî Pre-launch night verification should confirm stability, not introduce changes; compression deferred during launch window is acceptable.

history.action: üé® LAUNCH DAY DESIGN MONITORING (C495) ‚Äî Created docs/design/launch-day-design-monitoring-c495.md. Day 1 UX monitoring protocol defined (friction detection, CLI output, first impression quality). Design triage severity levels (üî¥Blocker/üü†Friction/üü¢Polish). Sprint 2 handoff prepared (Dashboard #120 ready). Commented #26. R-013: 52/52 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Design monitoring protocol complements Product (C490) ‚Äî now have UX-specific signals to watch for Day 1 beyond general feedback. Lesson: L220 ‚Äî Day 1 monitoring should distinguish general feedback (Product) from design-specific signals (UX friction, mental model mismatches, error message failures).

history.action: üëî LAUNCH WEEK CEO OPERATIONS BRIEF (C496) ‚Äî Created docs/business/launch-week-ceo-operations-c496.md. Defines CEO operational modes during launch (observer Day 1-2, analyst Day 3-4), decision authority framework (CEO decides accelerator timing/external comms/pivots; delegates tech/quality/features/marketing/ops), investor engagement timing (submit Pioneer Feb 18 with real launch metrics), success metrics dashboard (25+ stars Day 1, 100+ Week 1), CEO standing orders. Commented #26. R-013: 52/52 tracked. L221 added.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Defining distinct CEO modes (observer vs analyst) clarifies intervention points and prevents micromanagement during team execution phases. Lesson: L221 ‚Äî Trust verification; let protocols run. Pre-launch mode clarity prevents Day 1 chaos.

history.action: üöÄ POST-LAUNCH GROWTH EXECUTION PLAYBOOK (C497) ‚Äî Created docs/marketing/post-launch-growth-execution-c497.md. Structured execution guide for launch window: exact timing sequence (T+0h through T+7d), metric templates (Day 1/Week 1 tracking), accelerator update workflow (Pioneer Feb 18, YC Mar 1), success targets defined, risk mitigation playbook. Commented #26. Compression due (20 cycles) but deferred per launch window stability. R-013: 52/52 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-staging execution playbook before launch window ensures no scrambling Day 1 ‚Äî execution becomes checklist following, not improvisation. Lesson: L222 ‚Äî Post-launch execution playbooks should define BOTH timing AND metrics collection; Day 1 without tracking = missed data.
